P081161.project_name: Chongqing Small Cities Infrastructure Improvement Project

keywords.cdata: adequate water, adequate water supply, available water, available water resources, available water supply, benefit analysis, Central Government, certification, Competitive Bidding, conjunctive use, Construction, contract management, cost recovery, cost savings, counterpart funding, debt, drinking water, economic activity, Economic Analysis, economic development, economic growth, employment, environmental health, environmental issues, environmental sanitation, Exchange Rate, expenditures, financial resources, financial viability, flood control, flood damage, Flood Protection, ground water, income, inflation, international standards, investments in water supply, least cost, living conditions, living standards, local water, maintenance costs, market prices, Municipal Government, Municipal Management, municipal services, Municipal Water, municipal water supply, municipal water supply systems, OUTCOMES/RESULTS, Pacific Region, pollution, population centers, Private Sector, Project Management, Public Sanitation, Public toilet, public toilets, raw water, rivers, sanitation component, sanitation services, service delivery, SMALL CITIES, small towns, solid waste, solid waste management, sustainable development, Town, towns, urban areas, urban centers, Urban Environment, urban growth, utilities, wastewater, wastewater management, wastewater systems, wastewater treatment, water conservation, water demand, water resource, water resource management, Water Resources, water schemes, water s

project_abstract.cdata: The Chongqing Small Cities Infrastructure Improvement Project for China will support emerging small cities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of infrastructure service delivery, to accommodate the rapid urban growth. The project consists of five broad components : (a) Water Supply: (i) Dianjiang Water Supply: enhancement of water treatment, and network expansion in three areas of Dianjiang; (ii) Songji Regional Water Supply: supply of raw water to Yongchuan city; (iii) Tongguanyi Regional Water Supply: Regional water supply scheme supplying 16 towns in water scarce areas in the planned western expansion areas; (iv) Tongnan Water Supply: enhancement of water treatment, and network expansion in two areas of Tongnan; and (v) Yongchuan Water Supply: enhancement of water treatment, and network expansion in three small towns located close to Yongchuan city. (b) Flood Protection: (i) Nanchuan: flood protection embankments to mitigate against serious flood damage and protect land for urban expansion; (ii) Rongchang: flood protection embankments to mitigate against serious flood damage; and (iii) Shizhu: extension of existing flood protection embankment on the south side of the river. (c) Road Improvement and Construction: (i) Qianjiang: spine road in new development area; (ii) Shizhu: Shizhu expressway link road; (iii) Tongnan: link from Chongqing-Chengdu expressway to the key secondary city of Tongba; and (iv) Yubei: access road to tourist site from Y-L expressway. (d) Environmental Sanitation: Public toilet upgrading and reconstruction in Chongqing city. (e) Institutional Strengthening and Training: Technical assistance to: (i) strengthen finances, management and operations of utility companies; improve management capacity of parent units of local governments managing these companies, and develop a policy and pricing mechanism for the two regional water supply sche

P081161.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>重庆小城市基础设施改造项目 </ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>该项目由五个子项目构成，包括：1、通过加强污水处理，扩大网络以覆盖更多地区和城镇，从而改善供水；2、修建防洪堤坝；3、建设和改善道路；4、提供机构强化和技术援助，帮助提高设计实施质量，加强有关机构和地方政府的融资和运作能力。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
